track.name: If I Were a Bell
comments: One of the best recordings Miles EVER did, with ANYONE.
I'm getting the live one too. The way this band played bordered on the telepathic
listening to the version off Live at the Plugged Nickel - such a great song!
how much how much how much do i love this song.  i could never fully express.
This is amazing, and the piano! One of the best tracks from Miles.
One of the greatest jazz tracks I ever have heard.
Are words really necessary? What words could I display here that would make clear what is already clearly obvious... that Miles Davis was a genuis and that this particular song was perfect

If you were a bell you would have gone ding, dong, ding all the time. Fortunately you were a trumpet and blew it well. I'm glad of that. Very glad, in fact. The thought of those bells ringing in my head is too much. Those bells!
Those dam bells!  I'm so glad you decided to take up the trumpet and play the way you did, beautifully cool. Miles ahead of the rest, you played the trumpet
so very well. Memorably. Hauntingly.
